reviews.review:
Saying it's better than episode 7 and 8 is true. But instead of shit hitting the fan it's closer to a normal expected shitting the bed.

Pros:

Fun fights, lightsabers are shiny. Supporting cast was decent, and they had to improve on episode 8.

Shit the bed moments:

Palpatine came from nowhere, effectively invalidating episode 6. No reasons given. And George Lucas still sticks to Anakin being the chosen one bringing balance to the force by killing Palpatine (see interviews). Not creative enough to come up with their own big bad boss? Couldn't they just not have killed Snoke?

Ray can effectively do anything. She's a mechanic, expert marksman, master swordsman (cept against the little robot ball at the start), fully force sensitive and an overpowered healer. If only people knew how to use the force to instantly repair people previously. We might still have had Qui-Gonn.

People can suddenly transport objects and themselves across distances because the plot needed it. FML

Did they force couple Ray and Ben? How did that become a sudden thing? Maybe the force healing gets the libido going.

Ghosts can now catch lightsabers and move shit around. Ok then.

Leia had her own lightsaber and was able to beat Luke in a flashback - because they needed an extra lightsaber.

Made me question the point of episodes 2-6.

These are first impressions. I see one weird argument that one should watch the movies as if you're a 12 year old. That's a weak argument. Movies can be both readily accessible, fun AND still make sense to adults. Episodes 4 - 6 (and even 2 & 3 comparatively ) are rewatchable and make logical sense. Statements to the effect that "if you're a child it's a good movie" - do not mean it's a good movie!

Most of the above could have been avoided with having one or two star wars fans on the writing team.

It's really sad to see all the Star Wars hate surrounding the new trilogy.  I guess Star Wars is that polarizing of a franchise, becoming as big as it has, to cause all of the dissatisfaction.  In no way do I think every movie does everything right, nor have they done everything wrong.  Even the original trilogy has it's issues.  With that said, I think Rise of Skywalker was a great movie, from all the action sequences, fan service, and overall story.  There is a ton of throwback in here along with new ideas and concepts, in a great enough mix to surpass the shortcomings of The Last Jedi.  It's a fun and emotional ride, just as Star Wars always makes me feel with each film.
Thank you JJ for finishing it off right!

My entire family loved this movie from start to finish.  The Rise of Skywalker is so much better than The Last Jedi.  And unlike The Last Jedi, The Rise of Skywalker truly captures that Star Wars magic again...  Exciting plot, great chemistry between the main characters and beautiful settings and special effects make this movie an absolute must see for any true Star Wars fan!
It was good. I have to watch it a few times more to decide if I was happy with this ending of the Skywalker saga.

The Rise of Skywalker brings the story of Skywalker to a satisfying close! While there may be some who feel character arcs should have ended differently, I feel that the filmmakers gave us a great send off. 
Given the mixed to negative reviews I expected it to be somewhat disappointed however I was happily surprised. At the end of the day people who love Star Wars, love the characters, the special effects, the action and emotion will love this final installment in the Skywalker Saga!
This was definitely the best movie of the sequel trilogies. JJ completely redeemed the trilogy after what was the abomination called the Last Jedi.
Dude how in the world does this movie have a good fan rating LOL seriously I dont get it
More in the tradition of Star Wars then episode 7 and 8. The Force is strong in this one. The characterization of 4-6 with ability to show the prowess of the Jedi in 1-3
